title: JAM Session _1531 How to Use Daily Procedures to Ramp Up Your Communication Flow.pdf

pageContent: © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort  Andrea Schrag  Hesston College  June 3, 2016  How to Use Daily Procedures to Ramp Up Your Communication Flow © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort  Today’s Session:     Communication flow basics     Where we began     Building the communication flow  •   Deciding the audiences and material  •   Setting up merge documents, actions and action lists  •   Running daily procedures     Helpful notepad features  •   Mass Add  •   To Do lists © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     Communication flow a.k.a. comm flow  •   All print and electronic material that we have set up in Jenzabar to go out to our prospective students     Helps with quick follow up to students     Keeps students engaged     Helps admissions to be more organized  The Basics © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     Where we began:  •   Limited material  •   Bulk mailings that would occur one time  •   New into system = out of luck!     What we wanted:  •   Ramp up our material  •   Bulk mailings along with onesie-twosies  •   Everyone gets everything!     Preface     Consistency and organization is key!  Why? © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort  Create a Plan     Figure out your audiences.  •   We have an action list for every stage a student goes through the admissions process. © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     Decide what your audiences should receive.  •   Postcards, letters, emails, etc. © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     Map out the timing for each piece.  •   Dates vs. days to wait? © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort  1.   Merge Documents  2.   Actions  3.   Action Lists  Putting the Comm Flow in Jenzabar © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort  Setting Up Merge Documents     Create your document (letter, labels).     Mail merge – select recipients – .txt document  •   Our .txt documents are saved on a network drive.     Insert merge fields © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     Save your document.  •   Our documents are saved in folders to a network drive (access by permissions) where additional reports are stored.  •   We have organized the folders the same way as our actions lists.     Ex: Senior Inquiry, Senior Applicants © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     I named these by what made the most sense to us. It has worked great for us, but if we were to start over, I’d consider a more systematic method.  •   EM = email  •   PC = postcard  •   LE = letter  •   LB = labels  •   F = fall; S = spring  Naming of Merge Docs and Actions © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     Open Merge Documents – Right click – Add row  Setting Up Merge Documents © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     Enter in:  •   Letter- code for document (5 characters)  •   Module/Access- AD Admissions  •   Type- NOTEPAD  •   Document Description- description to help you remember document     Save – Double click row to open © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort  Find your existing document by using ‘...’ or Create Doc to start from scratch.  Select your .txt document by using ‘...’  Select the query you’d like to use. The queries are set up in Infomaker. © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     An action represents a part of the communication flow.     Actions can be:  •   Letters  •   Emails  •   Postcards  •   Phone calls  •   Envelopes  •   Labels     Actions – New Action  Setting Up Actions © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort  6 character name and short description of the action  Action type is OUTBOUND since piece will be going to students  You can assign this action to someone in To Do  Check “Don’t Allow Duplicate” if you don’t want a recipient to receive this more than once  Link your action to the appropriate merge document  Add details here © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort  Creating an Action List     An action list is made up of a group of actions.     Customizable to your audience     Action list – New Action List © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     Once again, I named these lists according to what made the most sense to us.  •   SR = senior; JR = junior; SO = sophomore; FR = freshmen  •   INQY/IQYD = inquiry; APP = applicant; ACPT/ACP = accepted  •   D = dates  Naming of Action Lists © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort  6 character name and short description of action list  Use drop down to select the action  Right click, “Add Row” to add another action  Enter in “days to wait” or start and end dates  Move actions in order of when you want them to occur. Use these buttons to rearrange actions. © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     Date specific or days to wait  •   What we did  Days to wait Date specific © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     You can stop an action list when a stage changes.  •   i.e. When a student applies, you may no longer want them receiving certain inquiry pieces.  Stopping Action Lists  Choose which action lists you want to stop with a stage change. Select it and click “Add.” © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     Action lists can automatically be added to notepad upon a stage change.     Stage Definition  Linking Action Lists to Stage Changes  Select which action list you want to link to the stage change. © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     We made an action list for almost all of our audiences.  •   Considering : transfer students, international students, traditional commuting students, non- traditional students  Our Comm Flow © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     More pieces for upperclassmen; seniors receive the most     As they move down the funnel, students will receive more information.  •   Senior admit = senior app + senior inquiry content, minus inquiry and app specific material  Admit  Inquiry  App  general material  specific material © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort  Running Daily Procedures  Select which actions to run  Select the module to run  You can choose to generate the letters or view the list of pending letters to see what will be generated. © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     This features allows you to add something to a large number of recipient’s notepad.     This is helpful with:  •   A communication that isn’t a part of an action list  •   Tracking for counselors, more efficient     When we put action lists on using Mass Add:  •   Students already in EX: mass add new action lists at the start of our comm flow cycle  •   New students to EX: add the action lists to notepad when they are entered into system  Mass Add © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     This feature allows anyone using notepad to be assigned to and see what tasks they need to complete.     Specific name or *Counselor     Helpful for admissions counselors and me to see what we need to work on for the day  To Do Lists © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort  What are your questions?  Contact me at:  Andrea Schrag andreas@hesston.edu  `
